page.title: 08WELD FARMS
page.content: On our map there are four farms that Weld Estates let of to different farmers.Some farm independently but others farm together with Mr.Weld.All the farms have dairy herds,these are Fresians or Fresian/Holstein cows.The number of cows in a herd ranges from 120 to 250.At the Newburgh Farm there are 750 Scottish Half Breed Sheep. These are a mixture of Scottish Sheep and Dorset Rams.They have two lambs each a year,they have proved to be good mothers. The crops that the farmers grow are Winter Wheat and Barley,Spring Wheat and Barley;Kale;Oil_seed Rape and Peas.Silage is grown for Winter feed. Tourists are also important.Profits from car parks and caravans are put back into the Estate.Last year 150 large trees were planted.The tourists also provide casual Summer employment.
